module.name: lazutf16
module.short: Contains routines used for UTF-16 character and string operations.

descr.p: lazutf16.pas includes string routines which are based on UTF-16 implementations, although it might also include routines for other encodings.
A UTF-16 based implementation for LowerCase, for example, is faster in WideString and UnicodeString then the default UTF-8 implementation.
Currently this unit includes only UTF8LowerCaseViaTables which is based on a UTF-16 table, but it might be extended to include various UTF-16 routines.
lazutf16.pas is part of the LazUtils package.

element.name: UTF16CharacterLength
element.short: Gets the length of the UTF-16 character in the specified PWideChar value as a number Word values.

descr.p: Uses the endian-ness for the platform. UTF16CharacterLength checks the first Word value in p to determine the return value for the routine, and can contain:

dl.dd: Returned when the value in the p argument is Nil.
Returned when the first Word value in p argument is outside the range $D800..$DFFF.
Returned when the first Word value in p argument is included in the range $D800..$DFFF.

element.name: UTF16CharacterLength.Result
element.short: Length of the UTF-16 character in the specified value, or 0 when Nil.

element.name: UTF16CharacterLength.p
element.short: PWideChar value examined in the routine.

element.name: UTF16Length
element.short: Gets the length for the specified value in UTF-16 characters.

descr.p: UTF16Length is an overloaded PtrInt function used to get the length for the specified value as a number of Unicode code points. The overloaded variants allow the string examined in the routine to be specified as either a UnicodeString or a PWideChar type. The variant using PWideChar includes the WordCount argument with the number of Word values in the input.

UTF16Length examines the input values to determine the number of code points for the return value. Each code point can be represented as either 1 or 2 word values in UTF-16. The UTF16CharacterLength routine is called for the input until the number of Word values has been examined in the method. The return value is incremented by 1 for each code point read from the input value.

element.name: UTF16Length.Result
element.short: Number of UTF-16 codepoints in the examined value.

element.name: UTF16Length.s
element.short: Unicode string with the values examined in the routine.

element.name: UTF16Length.p
element.short: Pointer to the WideChar values examined in the routine.

element.name: UTF16Length.WordCount
element.short: Number of UTF-16 word values to examine in the Unicode string.

element.name: UTF16Copy
element.short: Copies a number of UTF-16 characters at the given character position in the specified value.

element.name: UTF16Copy.Result
element.short: UnicodeString with the values copied in the routine.

element.name: UTF16Copy.s
element.short: UnicodeString with the values examined in the routine.

element.name: UTF16Copy.StartCharIndex
element.short: 1-based staring character (code point) position in the Unicode string.

element.name: UTF16Copy.CharCount
element.short: Number of characters (code points) copied in the routine.

element.name: UTF16CharStart
element.short: Gets a pointer to the Unicode character at the ordinal position in P specified by the CharIndex argument.

descr.p: P is the PWideChar value with the content examined in the routine.
Len contains the number of Word values examined in the P argument.
CharIndex specifies the ordinal position in P for the character pointer in the return value. CharIndex is zero-based and refers to a code point in P and not the individual Word values.

UTF16CharStart calls the UTF16CharacterLength routine to examine and skip each of the code points in P until the code point at CharIndex is found. The return value points to the Unicode character at the specified ordinal position. The return value is Nil for any of the following conditions:

ul.li: Len is zero or a negative number.
The code point at CharIndex does not exist in the specified Len.

element.name: UTF16CharStart.Result
element.short: Pointer to the Unicode character (code point) at the specified ordinal position.

element.name: UTF16CharStart.P
element.short: PWideChar value with the values examined in the routine.

element.name: UTF16CharStart.Len
element.short: Len is the number of Word values in P.

element.name: UTF16CharStart.CharIndex
element.short: CharIndex is the position for the desired UnicodeChar (starting at 0).

element.name: UTF16Pos
element.short: Pos implemented for UTF-16-encoded values.

descr.p: UTF16Pos is a PtrInt function used to get the character index in SearchInText where the value in SearchForText is located. StartPos allows the search to begin at a specific character (code point).
The return value is the 1-based UTF-16 character index where the SearchForText starts in SearchInText, or 0 when not found.

element.name: UTF16Pos.Result
element.short: Character index where the SearchForText starts in SearchInText, or 0 when not found.

element.name: UTF16Pos.SearchForText
element.short: UTF-16-encoded value to locate in SearchInText.

element.name: UTF16Pos.SearchInText
element.short: UTF-16-encoded value searched in the routine.

element.name: UTF16Pos.StartPos
element.short: Optional starting position (in UTF-16 code points, not in words).

element.name: UTF16CharacterToUnicode
element.short: Converts ordinal values for UTF-16 code points in p to its Unicode equivalent.

descr.p: UTF16CharacterToUnicode converts 16-bit values in p to the equivalent Unicode value.

Unpaired surrogates are invalid in any UTFs. These include any value in the range $D800..$DBFF not followed by a value in the range $DC00..$DFFF, or any value in the range $DC00..$DFFF not preceded by a value in the range $D800..$DBFF.

UTF16CharacterToUnicode ensures that ordinal value(s) in the reserved range(s) are converted to the correct Unicode value. CharLen is updated to reflect whether the values in p are a character represented by a single UTF-16 code point (1), or requires 2 code points for the surrogate pair (2). It is set to 0 when p contains an invalid UTF-16 code point.
The return value contains the Cardinal value for the Unicode code point, or 0 when p contains an invalid UTF-16 code point.

element.name: UTF16CharacterToUnicode.Result
element.short: Unicode code point for the values in p.

element.name: UTF16CharacterToUnicode.p
element.short: UTF-16 code points examined and converted in the routine.

element.name: UTF16CharacterToUnicode.CharLen
element.short: Number of UTF-16 code points for the converted character.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF16
element.short: Converts a Unicode character (code point) to its UTF-16 equivalent as a UnicodeString type.

descr.p: Cardinal values below $10000 result in a single WideChar value for the code point. Cardinal values in the range $D800 - $DFFF are reserved code points and contain 2 WideChar values in the result to represent the UTF-16 code point. WIdeChar values are cast to the UnicodeString type used in the return value.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF16.Result
element.short: UnicodeString value for the specified UTF-16 code point.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF16.u
element.short: Cardinal value with the UTF-16 code point converted in the routine.

element.name: IsUTF16CharValid
element.short: Returns True if the specified values are a valid UTF-16 character (codepoint).

descr.p: Based on the specification defined by the Unicode consortium, at:
Q: Are there any 16-bit values that are invalid?

A: Unpaired surrogates are invalid in UTFs. These include any value in the range D800 to DBFF not followed by a value in the range DC00 to DFFF, or any value in the range DC00 to DFFF not preceded by a value in the range D800 to DBFF. [AF]
If ANextChar is set to #0 there is no next character.

element.name: IsUTF16CharValid.Result
element.short: Returns False if AChar is #0 or AChar and ANextChar are unpaired surrogates.

element.name: IsUTF16CharValid.AChar
element.short: First UTF-16 code examined in the method.

element.name: IsUTF16CharValid.ANextChar
element.short: Next UTF-16 code examined in the method.

element.name: IsUTF16StringValid
element.short: Determines if the specified Unicode string contains valid UTF-16 code points.

descr.p: Examines the content in AStr for valid UTF-16 characters. Calls IsUTF16CharValid for consecutive code point pairs.

element.name: IsUTF16StringValid.Result
element.short: True if the specified Unicode string contains valid UTF-16 code points.

element.name: IsUTF16StringValid.AWideStr
element.short: Unicode string examined in the routine.

element.name: Utf16StringReplace
element.short: Replaces a pattern in a Unicode string with another Unicode pattern.

descr.p: Same as SysUtil.StringReplace but for WideStrings and UnicodeStrings, since it is not available in FPC yet.

element.name: Utf16StringReplace.Result
element.short: Updated value for Unicode string after pattern replacement(s).

element.name: Utf16StringReplace.S
element.short: Unicode string value examined in the routine.

element.name: Utf16StringReplace.OldPattern
element.short: Unicode string with the pattern to locate in S.

element.name: Utf16StringReplace.NewPattern
element.short: Unicode string with the pattern used to replace the old pattern in S.

element.name: Utf16StringReplace.Flags
element.short: Set of replacement flags applied in the routine.

element.name: Utf16StringReplace.Count
element.short: Number of replacements performed in the routine.

element.name: UnicodeLowercase
element.short: Converts the specified Unicode (UTF-16) codepoint to its lowercase equivalent.

descr.p: UnicodeLowercase ensures the character (16-bit codepoint) is converted to lowercase using the case conversion logic for the UTF-16 encoding. Characters in the following Unicode blocks are handled:

dl.dd: Capital letters in the C0 Latin block
Capital letters in the C1 Latin-1 Supplement block
Capital letters in the Latin Extended-A block
Capital letters in the Greek and Coptic block
Archaic letters in the Greek and Coptic block
Capital letters in the Armenian block
Capital letters in the Georgian block
Capital letters in the Latin Extended Additional block
Characters in the Letter-like Symbols block
Parenthesized Latin letters in the Enclosed Alphanumerics block
Capital letters in the Glagolitic block (precursor of Cyrillic)
Capital letters in the Latin Extended-C block
ASCII variants in the Halfwidth and Fullwidth Forms block

element.version: Modified in LazUtils version 4.0 to dynamically initialize the character mapping tables once when either UnicodeLowercase or UTF8LowerCaseViaTables is called.

element.name: UnicodeLowercase.Result
element.short: Cardinal value with the lowercase equivalent for u, or the value in u when conversion is not needed.

element.name: UnicodeLowercase.u
element.short: Cardinal value for the Unicode character converted to lowercase in the routine.

element.name: UTF8LowerCaseViaTables
element.short: Converts a UTF-8-encoded string to lowercase UTF-8 values using internal case tables.
element.version: Modified in LazUtils version 4.0 to dynamically initialize the character mapping tables once when either UnicodeLowercase or UTF8LowerCaseViaTables is called.

element.name: UTF8LowerCaseViaTables.Result
element.short: String with the lowercase UTF-8 values for s.

element.name: UTF8LowerCaseViaTables.s
element.short: String with UTF-8 values converted to lowercase UTF-8 in the routine.
